subject: Travel
title: The Lost City of Heracleion
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Lost City of Heracleion.

hook.text: Ancient Greeks wrote about Heracleion, a wealthy port at the mouth of the Nile. Then it vanished.

buildup.text: For 1,200 years, scholars thought the city was fiction, a legend with no real location.

discovery.text: In 2000, a diver found it submerged in Abu Qir Bay, Egypt, under 30 feet of water.

twist.text: Complete temples, giant statues, and 64 ancient ships lay perfectly preserved in the silt.

climax.text: Soil liquefaction from floods caused the ground to give way, sinking the entire city.

punchline.text: A legend turned out to be real and underwater.
